content: join with slip_stitch at end of ea round 84 begin single_crochet woven pattern round 18 chain 1 single_crochet in same single_crochet work single_crochet in next single_crochet 1 row below *single_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet 1 row below repeat from * around join with slip_stitch 84 round 19 chain 1 single_crochet in same single_crochet 1 row below single_crochet in next single_crochet *single_crochet in next single_crochet 1 row below single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat from * around join with slip_stitch 84 2 repeat rnds 18 and 19 until bag measures 8 from round 15 next round eyelet round chain 4 skip 1 single_crochet *double_crochet in next single_crochet chain 1 skip 1 single_crochet repeat from * around join with slip_stitch to 3rd chain of beg chain-4 next round chain 1 single_crochet in same chain single_crochet in ea space and double_crochet around join with slip_stitch 84 single_crochet next 4 rounds chain 1 single_crochet in ea single_crochet around join with slip_stitch 84 single_crochet fasten_off and weave in ends drawstring ties make 2 holding 2 strands together chain 120 fasten_off fold bag flat beginning at right side of eyelet row weave one end of chain under and over ea double_crochet around top of bag weave second chain in same manner starting at left side of bag hold ends of each separate chain together and tie in overhand knot weave yarn ends into knot to hide and secure them when you pull on drawstring ties top of bag should draw closed optional trim cut lengths of novelty scarf yarn and attach to bag as desired by inserting hook into a space between sts fold strand in half around hook pull loop through then pull loose ends through loop on hook and tighten or - use same yarn to make fringed strands attach as desired around top of bag then string pony beads on ends of strands a fabric lining can be sewn and inserted into bag tacking top to inside of bag below eyelet row copyright 2017 2004 kathy north www ravelry com/designers/kathy-north for personal or charity use only do not duplicate pattern for commercial purposes 3
